name: Family Oven-Finished Arroz con Pollo (Mild)
description: Comforting Latin arroz con pollo: seared chicken thighs baked with mildly seasoned rice, tomatoes, and peppers, finished with olives and fresh coriander.
prep_steps: Pat dry chicken thighs with paper towels; season both sides with salt and black pepper.
Dice onions and bell peppers; mince garlic.
Rinse jasmine rice in cold water until it runs mostly clear; drain well.
Measure chicken stock and open diced tomatoes; drain olives if using and slice if desired.
Roughly chop coriander; cut lime into wedges.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Sear chicken thighs skin-side down (or smooth side) 4–5 minutes until browned; flip and sear 2 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
Reduce heat to medium; add onions and bell peppers. Cook 3–4 minutes until softened, then add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Stir in ground cumin, paprika, and oregano; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add jasmine rice; stir 1 minute to coat in oil and aromatics.
Pour in diced tomatoes and chicken stock; add bay leaves and olives. Stir, taste the liquid, and adjust salt and black pepper to be well seasoned.
Nestle chicken thighs on top, skin-side up, keeping rice submerged. Bring to a gentle simmer on the StoveTop.
Cover tightly with a lid or foil and transfer to the Oven. Bake 25–30 minutes until rice is tender and liquid absorbed.
Rest covered 5 minutes. Remove bay leaves, fluff rice around the chicken, and sprinkle with coriander.
Serve with lime wedges for squeezing at the table.
